content.raw:
You mean gz-grant, right? Yes, it should be possible to use it.

And I agree that gz-accounts could handle creation / destruction. But in the interest of generalization, maybe we can make a component for that. What do you think? gz-resources?
content.html:
You mean gz-grant, right? Yes, it should be possible to use it.

And I agree that gz-accounts could handle creation / destruction. But in the interest of generalization, maybe we can make a component for that. What do you think? gz-resources?

content.raw: merged. 1600d7d
Just a convenient API to get only groups. I can remove it if not needed
content.html: Just a convenient API to get only groups. I can remove it if not needed

content.raw: using revoke 461e906
done. 461e906
done. 461e906
updated. 461e906

I think the cs-grant should be able to handle joining/leaving groups
As for creating/deleting groups, would this be a good job for gz-accounts?
Also, this PR does not address the token side of groups (give access to resource to a group member)
content.html: I think the cs-grant should be able to handle joining/leaving groups As for creating/deleting groups, would this be a good job for gz-accounts? Also, this PR does not address the token side of groups (give access to resource to a group member)
